page.title: 08ASH HALL-Werrington
page.content: Ash Hall was built in the early 19th Century,about 1837.It is a gothic style building and it had an extension built on the side during the Second World War.In the past hundred years or so the hall has had a variety of uses including:- hotel,hospital,country club and residence. The hall is now rented by the N.C.B., and it is used as offices. Somewhere in the house is supposed to be a secret passage leading to the public house across the road.There is also said to be a ghost that roams the hall.It is said to be the spirit of a former resident called Geoffrey Wood. From the entrance hall,on a clear day ,the whole of the Potteries can be seen. The whole estate covers between 4-5 acres,and includes it's own bowling green.
